skillTree.localised_description: The turbulent Winds of Magic can do little harm to those who have found harmony amidst its raging currents.
The best way to repel the chaotic flurry of missile fire is to meet it with order, discipline, and a stalwart row of shields.
Perhaps the most eclectic of the Cathayan warhosts. Serving Directly under Yuan Bo, the Celestial Court commands Cathay's Wizards and their magical craft in war.

effects.description:
Enables "Flammable" attacks for Great Moon Bird units, reducing fire resistance
	(all armies)

Ability number of uses: +2 for Wu Xing War Compass bound spells
	(all armies)

Bonus vs Infantry: +5 for Onyx Crowmen, Celestial Lion, Great Moon Bird, Jade Lion and Jet Lion units
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: The Jade Regiments do not serve the Jade Court directly, despite their name, but administrating Cathay's political and economical centre makes such matters irrelevant.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +3 for Jade Warriors, Jade Warriors (Halberds), Jade Warrior Crossbowmen, Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) and Jade Lancers units
	(all armies)

Melee defence: +3 for Jade Warriors, Jade Warriors (Halberds), Jade Warrior Crossbowmen, Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) and Jade Lancers units
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: The Celestial Court controls the Wizards of Cathayâ€¦ and one never plays their best cards too soon, or for the benefit of others.

effects.description:
Lord recruit rank: +5 for Dragon-blooded Shugengan
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The mere presence of the Jade Dragon ensures that paperwork flows like water, and Yuan Bo is the shark beneath the waves.

effects.description:
Construction time: -33% for all buildings
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: The Dragons are adept at appearing human, but none more so than Yuan Bo, who cultivates a guise that does not betray the inhuman mind behind the unflinching eyes.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with Humans and High Elves
Leadership aura size: +100% (when in human form)
Character's aura leadership effect: +10 (when in human form)

skillTree.localised_description: Little failures compound, and thus by aligning all things small and large with your purpose, you can banish all opposition.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +30%
	(when in own territory)

Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(when in own territory)

skillTree.localised_description: When the drums of war are sounded, entire regiments of Astromancers are prepared to meet the demands of the empire.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +15% for Astromancers
	(all characters)

skillTree.localised_description: When he discards the false image of humanity, Yuan Bo is a terrifying spectre of an age from before the thinking races of the world.

skillTree.localised_description: "Order is what separates us from the dark hordes of Chaos."

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
"Stability is what lets us do as this great work demands."

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Will execute units in combat below a 20% hit points threshold.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "The Emperor's Executioner"

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
"And so I shall create that stability with every movement of pen and blade."

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Dragon Emperor guides every sword and spear of the northern provinces, inspiring a strength of arms to match an unflinching strength of will.

skillTree.localised_description: From lowly peasant to expert marksman, every arrow of the east soars with a Draconic power and grace.

skillTree.localised_description: Ancient Cathay stands historically unconquered. Booming cannons and rockets of exploding fire help ensure it will remain so.

skillTree.localised_description: A blanket of glowing lights amidst the clouds is sure to stir the heart of every Cathayan warrior beneath them.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
All warriors of honour and pride are eager to fight under the Dragon-Emperor's banners.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Every wound that is not fatal is but a lesson to learn from.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: The blood-soaked battlefields of the northern provinces are the proving grounds upon which the mightiest warriors of Cathay have honed their craft.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.
